bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug description</denchmark-h>
When I specify api_token from os.environ["NEPTUNE_API_TOKEN"] I have the following warning <denchmark-code>WARNING: It is not secure to place API token in your source code. You should treat it as a password to your account. It is strongly recommended to use NEPTUNE_API_TOKEN environment variable instead. Remember not to upload source file with API token to any public repository. </denchmark-code>
When I remove api_token npt_logger = npt_module.NeptuneLogger( project_name="vfdev-5/my_project", experiment_name="test", params=config ) there is the following error: <denchmark-code> File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ignite/contrib/handlers/neptune_logger.py", line 447, in __init__ neptune.init(api_token=kwargs["api_token"], project_qualified_name=kwargs["project_name"]) KeyError: 'api_token' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jakubczakon>@jakubczakon</denchmark-link> shouldn't we explicitly set it up internally to None ? <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
PyTorch Version (e.g., 1.4): 1.4 Ignite Version (e.g., 0.3.0): 0.4.0.dev20200418 Neptune: 0.4.111

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vfdev-5>@vfdev-5</denchmark-link> I am looking into it right away.

Mhm, I see the problem. I'll fix and PR. The warning is on the neptune-client side, and it's not going to be converted to errors but still, it shouldn't be there. Basically It's enough to change the getting of values here from kwargs["api_token"] to kwargs.get("api_token"): neptune.init(api_token=kwargs.get("api_token"), project_qualified_name=kwargs.get("project_name"))
